verses.verse: Then they set <WH5265> out from Elim, <WH362> and all <WH3605> the congregation <WH5712> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came <WH935> to the wilderness <WH4057> of Sin, <WH9358> which <WH834> is between <WH996> Elim <WH362> and Sinai, <WH5514> on the fifteenth <WH2568> <WH6240> day <WH3117> of the second <WH8145> month <WH2320> after their departure <WH3318> from the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>
And the whole <WH3605> congregation <WH5712> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> grumbled <WH9235> against <WH5921> Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> in the wilderness. <WH4057>

And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to them, "Would <WH4310> <WH5414> that we had died <WH4191> by the Lord's hand <WH3027> in the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> when we sat <WH3427> by the pots <WH5518> of meat, <WH1320> when we ate <WH398> bread <WH3899> to the full; <WH7648> for you have brought <WH3318> us out into this <WH2088> wilderness <WH4057> to kill <WH4191> this <WH2088> whole <WH3605> assembly <WH6951> with hunger. <WH7458>"

Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Behold, <WH2009> I will rain <WH4305> bread <WH3899> from heaven <WH8064> for you; and the people <WH5971> shall go <WH3318> out and gather <WH3950> a day <WH3117>'s portion <WH1697> every day, that I may test <WH5254> them, whether or <WH518> not they will walk <WH1980> in My instruction. <WH8451>

"And it will come <WH1961> about on the sixth <WH8345> day, <WH3117> when they prepare <WH3559> what <WH834> they bring <WH935> in, it will be twice <WH4932> as much <WH834> as they gather <WH3950> daily. <WH3117>"

So Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> said <WH559> to all <WH3605> the sons <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> "At evening <WH6153> you will know <WH3045> that the Lord <WH3068> has brought <WH3318> you out of the land <WH776> of Egypt; <WH4714>

and in the morning <WH1242> you will see <WH7200> the glory <WH9202> of the Lord, <WH3068> for He hears <WH8085> your grumblings <WH8519> against <WH5921> the Lord; <WH3068> and what <WH4100> are we, that you grumble <WH9235> against <WH5921> us? "

And Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "[This will happen] when the Lord <WH3068> gives <WH5414> you meat <WH1320> to eat <WH398> in the evening, <WH6153> and bread <WH3899> to the full <WH7646> in the morning; <WH1242> for the Lord <WH3068> hears <WH8085> your grumblings <WH8519> which <WH834> you grumble <WH9235> against <WH5921> Him. And what <WH4100> are we? Your grumblings <WH8519> are not against <WH5921> us but against <WH5921> the Lord. <WH3068>"

Then Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to Aaron, <WH175> "Say <WH559> to all <WH3605> the congregation <WH5712> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> 'Come <WH7126> near <WH7126> before <WH6440> the Lord, <WH3068> for He has heard <WH8085> your grumblings. <WH8519>'"

And it came <WH1961> about as Aaron <WH175> spoke <WH1696> to the whole <WH3605> congregation <WH5712> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> that they looked <WH6437> toward <WH413> the wilderness, <WH4057> and behold, <WH2009> the glory <WH9202> of the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> in the cloud. <WH6051>
And the Lord <WH3068> spoke <WH1696> to Moses, <WH4872> saying, <WH559>

"I have heard <WH8085> the grumblings <WH8519> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel; <WH3478> speak <WH1696> to them, saying, <WH559> 'At twilight <WH6153> you shall eat <WH398> meat, <WH1320> and in the morning <WH1242> you shall be filled <WH7646> with bread; <WH3899> and you shall know <WH3045> that I am the Lord <WH3068> your God. <WH430>'"

So it came <WH1961> about at evening <WH6153> that the quails <WH7958> came <WH5927> up and covered <WH3680> the camp, <WH4264> and in the morning <WH1242> there was a layer <WH7902> of dew <WH2919> around <WH5439> the camp. <WH4264>

When the layer <WH7902> of dew <WH2919> evaporated, <WH5927> behold, <WH2009> on the surface <WH6440> of the wilderness <WH4057> there was a fine <WH1851> flake-like thing, <WH2636> fine <WH1851> as the frost <WH9214> on the ground. <WH776>

When the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> saw <WH7200> [it,] they said <WH559> to one <WH376> another, <WH251> "What <WH9271> is it?" For they did not know <WH3045> what <WH4100> it was. And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to them, "It is the bread <WH3899> which <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> you to eat. <WH402>

"This <WH2088> is what <WH1697> <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> has commanded, <WH6680> 'Gather <WH3950> of it every <WH376> man <WH376> as much <WH6310> as he should eat; <WH398> you shall take <WH3947> an omer <WH9418> apiece <WH1538> according to the number <WH4557> of persons <WH5315> each <WH376> of you has <WH3947> in his tent. <WH168>'"
And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> did <WH6213> so, <WH3651> and [some] gathered <WH3950> much <WH7235> and [some] little. <WH4591>

When they measured <WH4058> it with an omer, <WH9418> he who had <WH7235> gathered much <WH7235> had no <WH3808> excess, <WH5736> and he who had <WH4591> gathered little <WH4591> had no <WH3808> lack; <WH2637> every <WH376> man <WH376> gathered <WH3950> as much <WH6310> as he should eat. <WH398>
And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to them, "Let no <WH408> man <WH376> leave <WH3498> any <WH4480> of it until <WH5704> morning. <WH1242>"

But they did not listen <WH8085> to Moses, <WH4872> and some <WH376> left <WH3498> part of it until <WH5704> morning, <WH1242> and it bred <WH9560> worms <WH8438> and became <WH887> foul; <WH887> and Moses <WH4872> was angry <WH7107> with them.

And they gathered <WH3950> it morning <WH1242> by morning, <WH1242> every <WH376> man <WH376> as much <WH6310> as he should eat; <WH398> but when the sun <WH8121> grew <WH2552> hot, <WH2552> it would melt. <WH4549>

Now it came <WH1961> about on the sixth <WH8345> day <WH3117> they gathered <WH3950> twice <WH4932> as much <WH4932> bread, <WH3899> two <WH8147> omers <WH9418> for each <WH259> one. <WH259> When all <WH3605> the leaders <WH5387> of the congregation <WH5712> came <WH935> and told <WH5046> Moses, <WH4872>

then he said <WH559> to them, "This <WH1931> is what <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> meant: <WH1696> Tomorrow <WH4279> is a sabbath <WH7677> observance, <WH7677> a holy <WH6944> sabbath <WH7676> to the Lord. <WH3068> Bake <WH644> what <WH834> you will bake <WH644> and boil <WH1310> what <WH834> you will boil, <WH1310> and all <WH3605> that is left <WH5736> over <WH5736> put <WH5117> aside <WH5117> to be kept <WH4931> until <WH5704> morning. <WH1242>"

So they put <WH5117> it aside <WH5117> until <WH5704> morning, <WH1242> as Moses <WH4872> had ordered, <WH6680> and it did not become <WH887> foul, <WH887> nor <WH3808> was there any worm <WH7415> in it.
And Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "Eat <WH398> it today, <WH3117> for today <WH3117> is a sabbath <WH7676> to the Lord; <WH3068> today <WH3117> you will not find <WH4672> it in the field. <WH7704>
"Six <WH8337> days <WH3117> you shall gather <WH3950> it, but on the seventh <WH7637> day, <WH3117> [the] sabbath, <WH7676> there will be none. <WH3808>"
And it came <WH1961> about on the seventh <WH7637> day <WH3117> that some <WH4480> of the people <WH5971> went <WH3318> out to gather, <WH3950> but they found <WH4672> none. <WH3808>
Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "How <WH575> long <WH5704> do you refuse <WH3985> to keep <WH8104> My commandments <WH4687> and My instructions <WH8451>?

"See, <WH7200> the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> you the sabbath; <WH7676> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> He gives <WH5414> you bread <WH3899> for two days <WH3117> on the sixth <WH8345> day. <WH3117> Remain <WH3427> every <WH376> man <WH376> in his place; <WH8478> let no <WH408> man <WH376> go <WH3318> out of his place <WH4725> on the seventh <WH7637> day. <WH3117>"
So the people <WH5971> rested <WH7673> on the seventh <WH7637> day. <WH3117>

And the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> named <WH7121> <WH8034> it manna, <WH4478> and it was like coriander <WH1407> seed, <WH2233> white; <WH3836> and its taste <WH2940> was like wafers <WH6838> with honey. <WH1706>

Then Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "This <WH2088> is what <WH1697> <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> has commanded, <WH6680> 'Let an omerful <WH4393> <WH9418> of it be kept <WH4931> throughout your generations, <WH1755> that they may see <WH7200> the bread <WH3899> that I fed <WH398> you in the wilderness, <WH4057> when I brought <WH3318> you out of the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>'"

And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to Aaron, <WH175> "Take <WH3947> a jar <WH6803> and put <WH5414> an omerful <WH4393> <WH9418> of manna <WH4478> in it, and place <WH5117> it before <WH6440> the Lord, <WH3068> to be kept <WH4931> throughout your generations. <WH1755>"
As the Lord <WH3068> commanded <WH6680> Moses, <WH4872> so Aaron <WH175> placed <WH5117> it before <WH6440> the Testimony, <WH5715> to be kept. <WH4931>

And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> ate <WH398> the manna <WH4478> forty <WH705> years, <WH8141> until <WH5704> they came <WH935> to an inhabited <WH3427> land; <WH776> they ate <WH398> the manna <WH4478> until <WH5704> they came <WH935> to the border <WH7097> of the land <WH776> of Canaan. <WH3667>
(Now an omer <WH9418> is a tenth <WH6224> of an ephah. <WH374>)
